clues.text: According to Ted Williams, Babe Ruth had one that weighed 54 ounces
Spelled "G-E-R-D" in Old English where it meant a small stick, it now means a precise length
It's the only measure of distance mentioned in the poem "The Charge of the Light Brigade"
Used in surveying, a chain is divided into 100 units called these
In metric prefixes, kilo- means thousandfold & this means thousandth part
Yokohama is on the bay named for this larger city
It's the ocean bordering Australia to the west
In both area & population it's the 2nd largest country in South America
Only country on the American mainland that borders only 1 other country
The Portuguese found a lot of this in what is now Ghana, hence the name of its coast
It is this "that blows nobody any good"
"East or west", this "is best"
In his collection "Hesperides", Robert Herrick advised to do this "while ye may"
Proverbial phrase that precedes "... so is the tree inclined"
1st half of proverb that ends "... & God for us all"

The 1689 Battle of Killiecrankie in this country:
the Jacobites

The 1876 battle of this river:
the Lakota & the Cheyenne

The Union:
the 1865 battle of this Court House

The 1940 Battle of Britain:
this group of aviators

The October 14, 1066 Battle of this:
William the Conqueror
This actor, in "Endgame": "Are you seriously telling me that your plan to save the universe is based on 'Back to the Future'?"
Zoinks! It was a double dose of Jr.s with Freddie Prinze Jr. as Fred & Miguel A. Núñez Jr. in a 2002 film named for this cartoon dog
Tha (Dwayne) Carter Jr. went platinum at age 17 when he was with the Hot Boys, but you may know him under this nom de rap
The fans' choice as NASCAR's Most Popular Driver 15 straight times, he voiced himself--well, a version of himself--in "Cars"
UT Austin's trove of material from this Jr.'s career includes his "Raging Bull" boxing robe & even scripts from "Dirty Grandpa"
"To happily follow wherever you may lead" employs this, once verboten but less so today
Generations have done this to the Latin verb for "to love": amo, amas, amat, amamus, amatis, amant
A Big Red "S.F." on a term paper stands for this, a sequence of words lacking subject, verb or both
This grammatical case doesn't mean blaming someone but indicates that a noun is a direct object of a verb
Parataxis is where you place clauses, you insert phrases, you add thoughts one after the other without using these
A person born in the 1980s or early 1990s

It means once a year
Literally without a cent
On a military base, it's a grocery store; at a movie studio, it's a lunchroom

rounds.comments: (Mayim: Jeopair! is an airline we made up.)

clues.text: Come on up, lanyard-wearing "unaccompanied" these not-yet-voters
We're happy to greet passengers in this cabin, also a 2011 "X-Men" prequel with mutants like Riptide & Emma Frost
We invite aboard those who've achieved this Jeopair! status, a synonym for highest found before "being" to refer to God
Boarding group 11, in a class we call this synonym for basic or elemental & just as it sounds, comes from Latin for "rude"
We welcome all active duty military to board, & we do this common 5-word phrase said to our folks in uniform
This god of love hid Psyche & visited in secret until she found out who he was
The theme song to the James Bond film "Goldfinger" mentions this king of Phrygia
She used her magic to help Jason, but after 10 years of marriage, he wed another; she killed her own children & the second wife
She was chained to a rock, left to be devoured by a sea monster; Perseus swooped in & saved her
Among Greek heroes, No. 1 is Achilles & No. 2 is this son of Telamon who rescues Achilles' body from the Trojans
The State Hermitage Museum is in this "saintly" Russian city
In 1809 John Molson linked Quebec & this city by water with the first Canadian steamboat
Over 10,000 feet in elevation, this South American capital is one of the International Cities of Peace
The worker bee is a symbol of this industrial city in northern England & represents unity since a 2017 bombing there
You can study physics at the Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in this city, like 1900 grad Albert Einstein did
George Blanda kicked an NFL record 943 of these
ESP is short for this purported ability that includes mind reading & precognition
Partly from the Latin for "wander", it's a spectacular event
Chad & Samoa are 2 countries with which the U.S. has no treaty for this process of returning wanted criminal suspects
Forecasting the temperature at a location based on historic data is an example of this process
Change one letter in Volga & you'll get this major river in West Africa
It's the name the British use for the islands the Argentines call Islas Malvinas
At about 12,000' above sea level, this national capital of Bolivia is the highest capital in the world
The northernmost spot in the United States is this point in Alaska
Up until 1970 the name of this country included its capital, Muscat

rounds.text: 2 of the 5 presidents who were never elected president
rounds.response: (2 of) Gerald Ford, Andrew Johnson, (John) Tyler, (Millard) Fillmore or (Chester) Arthur
